metadata.title: CVE-2023-52503 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: tee:amdtee: fix use-after-free vulnerability in amdtee_close_session There is apotential race condition in amdtee_close_session that may causeuse-after-free in amdtee_open_session. For instance, if a session hasrefcount == 1, and one thread tries to free this session via:kref_put(&sess->refcount, destroy_session); the reference count will getdecremented, and the next step would be to call destroy_session(). However,if in another thread, amdtee_open_session() is called beforedestroy_session() has completed execution, alloc_session() may return'sess' that will be freed up later in destroy_session() leading touse-after-free in amdtee_open_session. To fix this issue, treat decrementof sess->refcount and removal of 'sess' from session list indestroy_session() as a critical section, so that it is executed atomically.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52503` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1027.32').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2000.4').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2013.14').
